member.name: T:NServiceBus.Address
member.summary: Abstraction for an address on the NServiceBus network.

member.name: M:NServiceBus.Address.InitializeLocalAddress(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the address of this endpoint. Will throw an exception if overwriting a previous value (but value will still be set).

member.name: M:NServiceBus.Address.OverrideDefaultMachine(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the address mode, can only be done as long as the local address is not been initialized.By default the default machine equals Environment.MachineName

member.name: M:NServiceBus.Address.InitializeAddressMode(NServiceBus.AddressMode)
member.summary: Sets the name of the machine to be used when none is specified in the address.

member.summary: Parses a string and returns an Address.

member.summary: Deserializes an Address.

member.name: M:NServiceBus.Address.SubScope(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new Address whose Queue is derived from the Queue of the existing Address together with the provided qualifier. For example: queue.qualifier@machine

member.summary: Provides a hash code of the Address.

member.name: M:NServiceBus.Address.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string representation of the address.

member.name: M:NServiceBus.Address.PreventChanges
member.summary: Prevents changes to all addresses.

member.returns: true if the LHS is equal to RHS

member.summary: Overloading for the != for the class Address

Right hand side of != operator
member.returns: true if the LHS is not equal to RHS

member.summary: Determines whether the specified is equal to the current .
member.returns: true if the specified is equal to the current ; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Check this is equal to other Address

member.summary: Extension method on MessageHandler. Users can avoid declaring an IBus to be injected, and use the bus implicitly.

member.summary: Class containing extension methods for base class libraries for using interface-based messages.

member.summary: The action used to set the header in the method.

member.summary: The action used to get the header value in the method.

member.summary: Instantiates an instance of T and adds it to the list.

An action for setting properties of the created instance.

member.name: M:NServiceBus.ExtensionMethods.GetHeader(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Get the header with the given key. Cannot be used to change its value.

member.name: M:NServiceBus.ExtensionMethods.GetHttpFromHeader(System.Object)
member.summary: If the source of this message was an Http endpoint, returns its address otherwise returns null.

member.name: M:NServiceBus.ExtensionMethods.GetHttpToHeader(System.Object)
member.summary: If the target destination of this message is an Http endpoint, return the address of that target, otherwise null.

member.name: M:NServiceBus.ExtensionMethods.GetDestinationSitesHeader(System.Object)
member.summary: Returns the list of destination sites for this message

member.name: M:NServiceBus.ExtensionMethods.GetOriginatingSiteHeader(System.Object)
member.summary: Returns the sitekey for the site for which this message originated, null if this message wasn't sent via the gateway

member.name: M:NServiceBus.ExtensionMethods.SetHeader(System.Object,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the value of the header for the given key.

member.name: M:NServiceBus.ExtensionMethods.SetDestinationSitesHeader(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the list of sites to where this message should be routed This method is reserved for the NServiceBus Gateway.

member.name: M:NServiceBus.ExtensionMethods.SetOriginatingSiteHeader(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the originating site header This method is reserved for the NServiceBus Gateway.

member.name: M:NServiceBus.ExtensionMethods.SetHttpFromHeader(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the Http address from which this message was received. This method is reserved for the NServiceBus Gateway.

member.name: M:NServiceBus.ExtensionMethods.SetHttpToHeader(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the Http address to which this message should be sent. Requires the use of the NServiceBus Gateway.

member.name: M:NServiceBus.ExtensionMethods.CopyHeaderFromRequest(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Gets the value of the header with the given key and sets it for this message.

member.name: P:NServiceBus.ExtensionMethods.MessageCreator
member.summary: The object used by the extention methods to instantiate types.

member.name: P:NServiceBus.ExtensionMethods.Bus
member.summary: The object used by the extension methods for accessing headers.

member.name: P:NServiceBus.ExtensionMethods.CurrentMessageBeingHandled
member.summary: The object used to see whether headers requested are for the handled message.

member.name: P:NServiceBus.ExtensionMethods.GetStaticOutgoingHeadersAction
member.summary: The action used to get all the headers for a message.

member.name: T:NServiceBus.Headers
member.summary: Static class containing headers used by NServiceBus.

member.name: F:NServiceBus.Headers.HttpFrom
member.summary: Header for retrieving from which Http endpoint the message arrived.

member.name: F:NServiceBus.Headers.HttpTo
member.summary: Header for specifying to which Http endpoint the message should be delivered.

member.name: F:NServiceBus.Headers.RouteTo
member.summary: Header for specifying to which queue behind the http gateway should the message be delivered. This header is considered an applicative header.

member.name: F:NServiceBus.Headers.DestinationSites
member.summary: Header for specifying to which sites the gateway should send the message. For multiple sites a comma separated list can be used This header is considered an applicative header.

member.name: F:NServiceBus.Headers.OriginatingSite
member.summary: Header for specifying the key for the site where this message originated. This header is considered an applicative header.

member.name: F:NServiceBus.Headers.Expire
member.summary: Header for time when a message expires in the timeout manager This header is considered an applicative header.

member.name: F:NServiceBus.Headers.RouteExpiredTimeoutTo
member.summary: Header for redirecting the expired timeout to a endpoint other than the one setting the Timeout This header is considered an applicative header.

member.name: F:NServiceBus.Headers.SagaId
member.summary: Header containing the id of the saga instance the sent the message This header is considered an applicative header.

member.name: F:NServiceBus.Headers.ClearTimeouts
member.summary: Header telling the timeout manager to clear previous timeouts This header is considered an applicative header.

member.name: F:NServiceBus.Headers.HeaderName
member.summary: Prefix included on the wire when sending applicative headers.

member.name: F:NServiceBus.Headers.WindowsIdentityName
member.summary: Header containing the windows identity name

member.name: F:NServiceBus.Headers.NServiceBusVersion
member.summary: Header telling the NServiceBus Version (beginning NServiceBus V3.0.1).

member.name: F:NServiceBus.Headers.ReturnMessageErrorCodeHeader
member.summary: Used in a header when doing a callback (bus.return)

member.name: F:NServiceBus.Headers.ControlMessageHeader
member.summary: Header that tells if this transport message is a control message

member.name: F:NServiceBus.Headers.SagaType
member.summary: Type of the saga that this message is targeted for

member.name: F:NServiceBus.Headers.SagaEntityType
member.summary: Type of the saga that sent this message

member.name: F:NServiceBus.Headers.OriginatingSagaId
member.summary: Id of the saga that sent this message

member.name: F:NServiceBus.Headers.OriginatingSagaType
member.summary: Type of the saga that sent this message

member.name: F:NServiceBus.Headers.Retries
member.summary: The number of retries that has been performed for this message

member.name: T:NServiceBus.IAuthorizeSubscriptions
member.summary:
Implementer will be called by the infrastructure in order to authorize subscribe and unsubscribe requests from other endpoints.
Infrastructure automatically registers one implementing type in the container as a singleton.

member.summary: Return true if the client endpoint is to be allowed to subscribe to the given message type. Implementors can access the impersonated user via

member.summary: Return true if the client endpoint is to be allowed to unsubscribe to the given message type.

member.summary: Publishes the list of messages to subscribers. If publishing multiple messages, they should all be of the same type since subscribers are identified by the first message in the list.
member.param: A list of messages. The first message's type is used for looking up subscribers.

member.summary: Instantiates a message of type T and publishes it.

member.param: An action which initializes properties of the message

member.summary: Subscribes to recieve published messages of type T. This method is only necessary if you turned off auto-subscribe.
member.typeparam: The type of message to subscribe to.

The condition with which to evaluate messages.

member.param: The condition with which to evaluate messages.

member.name: M:NServiceBus.IBus.SendToSites(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.Object[])
member.summary: Sends the messages to all sites with matching site keys registered with the gateway. The gateway is assumed to be located at the master node.

member.name: M:NServiceBus.IBus.Defer(System.TimeSpan,System.Object[])
member.summary: Defers the processing of the messages for the given delay. This feature is using the timeout manager so make sure that you enable timeouts

member.name: M:NServiceBus.IBus.Defer(System.DateTime,System.Object[])
member.summary: Defers the processing of the messages until the specified time. This feature is using the timeout manager so make sure that you enable timeouts

member.name: M:NServiceBus.IBus.Reply(System.Object[])
member.summary: Sends all messages to the endpoint which sent the message currently being handled on this thread.

member.summary: Instantiates a message of type T and performs a regular .

member.param: An action which initializes properties of the message

member.name: M:NServiceBus.IBus.Return``1(``0)
member.summary: Returns a completion message with the specified error code to the sender of the message being handled. The type T can only be an enum or an integer.

member.name: M:NServiceBus.IBus.HandleCurrentMessageLater
member.summary: Moves the message being handled to the back of the list of available messages so it can be handled later.

member.name: M:NServiceBus.IBus.ForwardCurrentMessageTo(System.String)
member.summary: Forwards the current message being handled to the destination maintaining all of its transport-level properties and headers.

member.name: M:NServiceBus.IBus.DoNotContinueDispatchingCurrentMessageToHandlers
member.summary: Tells the bus to stop dispatching the current message to additional handlers.

member.name: P:NServiceBus.IBus.OutgoingHeaders
member.summary:
Gets the list of key/value pairs that will be in the header of messages being sent by the same thread.
This value will be cleared when a thread receives a message.

member.name: P:NServiceBus.IBus.CurrentMessageContext
member.summary: Gets the message context containing the Id, return address, and headers of the message currently being handled on this thread.

member.name: T:NServiceBus.ICallback
member.summary: Objects of this interface are returned from calling IBus.Send. The interface allows the caller to register for a callback when a response is received to their original call to IBus.Send.

member.name: M:NServiceBus.ICallback.Register(System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Registers a callback to be invoked when a response arrives to the message sent.
member.param: The callback to invoke.
State that will be passed to the callback method.
member.returns: An IAsyncResult useful for integration with ASP.NET async tasks.

member.name: M:NServiceBus.ICallback.Register``1(System.Action{``0})
member.summary: Registers a callback to be invoked when a response arrives to the message sent. The return code is cast to the given enumerated type - T.
member.typeparam: An enumeration type or an integer.

member.name: M:NServiceBus.ICallback.Register``1(System.Action{``0},System.Object)
member.summary: Registers a callback to be invoked when a response arrives to the message sent. The return code is cast to the given enumerated type - T. Pass either a System.Web.UI.Page or a System.Web.Mvc.AsyncController as the synchronizer.

member.name: T:NServiceBus.IMessage
member.summary: Marker interface to indicate that a class is a message suitable for transmission and handling by an NServiceBus.

member.name: T:NServiceBus.ICommand
member.summary: Marker interface to indicate that a class is a command message

member.name: T:NServiceBus.IEvent
member.summary: Marker interface to indicate that a class is a event message

member.name: T:NServiceBus.RecoverableAttribute
member.summary: Attribute to indicate that a message is recoverable - this is now the default.
member.remarks: This attribute should be applied to classes that implement to indicate that they should be treated as a recoverable message. A recoverable message is stored locally at every step along the route so that in the event of a failure of a machine along the route a copy of the message will be recovered and delivery will continue when the machine is brought back online.

member.name: T:NServiceBus.ExpressAttribute
member.summary: Attribute to indicate that the message should not be written to disk. This will make the message vulnerable to server crashes or restarts.

member.name: T:NServiceBus.TimeToBeReceivedAttribute
member.summary: Attribute to indicate that a message has a period of time in which to be received.

member.name: M:NServiceBus.TimeToBeReceivedAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Sets the time to be received to be unlimited.

member.name: M:NServiceBus.TimeToBeReceivedAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the time to be received.
member.param: A timespan that can be interpreted by .

member.name: P:NServiceBus.TimeToBeReceivedAttribute.TimeToBeReceived
member.summary: Gets the maximum time in which a message must be received.
member.remarks: If the interval specified by the TimeToBeReceived property expires before the message is received by the destination of the message the message will automatically be cancelled.

member.name: T:NServiceBus.IMessageContext
member.summary: Contains out-of-band information on the logical message.

member.name: P:NServiceBus.IMessageContext.Id
member.summary: Returns the Id of the message.

member.name: P:NServiceBus.IMessageContext.ReturnAddress
member.summary: Returns the address of the endpoint that sent this message.

member.name: P:NServiceBus.IMessageContext.ReplyToAddress
member.summary: The address of the endpoint that sent the current message being handled.

member.name: P:NServiceBus.IMessageContext.TimeSent
member.summary: Returns the time at which the message was sent.

member.name: P:NServiceBus.IMessageContext.Headers
member.summary: Gets the list of key/value pairs found in the header of the message.

member.summary: Defines a message handler.

member.name: M:NServiceBus.IMessageHandler`1.Handle(`0)
member.summary: Handles a message.

member.name: T:NServiceBus.IHandleMessages`1
member.summary: Implement this class to be called when messages of the given type arrive at your endpoint.

member.name: T:NServiceBus.IMessageModule
member.summary: Implementers will be called before and after all message handlers.

member.summary: This method is called before any message handlers are called.

member.name: M:NServiceBus.IMessageModule.HandleEndMessage
member.summary: This method is called after all message handlers have been called.

member.name: M:NServiceBus.IMessageModule.HandleError
member.summary: This method is called if there was an error in processing the message, and may be called after .

member.summary: Specifies the type which will run next

member.name: T:NServiceBus.Saga.IHandleSagaNotFound
member.summary: Implementors will be invoked when a message arrives that should have been processed by a saga, but no existing saga was found. This does not include the scenario when a saga will be created for the given message type.

member.summary: Implementors will implement this method, likely using an injected IBus to send responses to the client who sent the message.

member.summary: The saga's data.

member.summary: Used for retrieving the endpoint which caused the saga to be initiated.

member.summary: A more strongly typed version of ISaga meant to be implemented by application developers

member.summary: The saga's data.

member.name: T:NServiceBus.Saga.ISagaEntity
member.summary: Defines the basic data used by long-running processes.

member.name: P:NServiceBus.Saga.ISagaEntity.Id
member.summary: Gets/sets the Id of the process. Do NOT generate this value in your code. The value of the Id will be generated automatically to provide the best performance for saving in a database.
member.remarks: The reason Guid is used for process Id is that messages containing this Id need to be sent by the process even before it is persisted.

member.name: P:NServiceBus.Saga.ISagaEntity.Originator
member.summary: Contains the return address of the endpoint that caused the process to run.

member.name: P:NServiceBus.Saga.ISagaEntity.OriginalMessageId
member.summary: Contains the Id of the message which caused the saga to start. This is needed so that when we reply to the Originator, any registered callbacks will be fired correctly.

member.name: T:NServiceBus.Saga.IContainSagaData
member.summary: The saga data that will be persisted.

member.summary: An interface used to mark messages as requiring the attention of the saga infrastructure.

member.name: P:NServiceBus.Saga.ISagaMessage.SagaId
member.summary: Gets/sets the Id of the saga the message is related to.

member.name: T:NServiceBus.Saga.UniqueAttribute

member.returns: A PropertyInfo of the property marked with a UniqAttribute or null if not used
